item.title: Exploring Redis streams with Akka streams
item.description: In this post we will explore using Redis streams in Akka streams using the popular Java library Lettuce; Redis is an in-memory database used in distributed systems, and Akka streams is a popular reactive streams implementation for Scala. The streams data structure in Redis implements a persistent log with support for consumer groups, this is a data structure designed to fan out messages to multiple consumers and there is a good but lengthy introduction to Redis streams on the Redis website, but roughly speaking there are three classes of operation:
